conclusion: To determine whether the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is greater than or less than 75 meters, we need to analyze the area under the velocity-time (v-t) graph for that interval. The area under the v-t graph represents the distance traveled.
The interval of interest is from t = 10 seconds to t = 15 seconds.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is approximately 20 m/s.
At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is approximately 10 m/s.
The graph between t = 10 seconds and t = 15 seconds appears to be a straight line, indicating a constant deceleration.

premise: The area under the graph can be approximated as a trapezoid.
conclusion: The formula for the area of a trapezoid is: Area = 1/2 × (Base1 + Base2) × Height

premise: Base1 = 20 m/s, Base2 = 10 m/s, and Height = 5 seconds.
conclusion: Substitute the values into the trapezoid area formula.

premise: The area under the graph from t = 10 seconds to t = 15 seconds is exactly 75 meters.
conclusion: The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is exactly 75 meters.
